title: Integrative Psychiatry integrative psychiatry
description: Integrative Psychiatry includes medications, stress reduction, functional tests, supplements and botanicals, psychotherapy, bodywork.
cleaned_text: What is Integrative Psychiatry? Integrative psychiatry is becoming increasingly popular as more people seek out complementary and more holistic treatments for mental health issues. It offers a way to address mental health concerns that goes beyond the limitations of traditional psychiatric treatment and acknowledges the importance of a multidisciplinary approach to mental health care. This approach recognizes that mental health is influenced by a variety of factors and that treatment should be personalized to meet the unique needs of each individual. Integrative psychiatry emphasizes the importance of addressing underlying imbalances and root causes of mental health issues rather than just treating symptoms. This may include [functional medicine tests](https://gwcim.com/services/naturopathic-medicine/), nutrition, exercise, [stress reduction](https://gwcim.com/services/mbsr_course_info/), and the use of natural supplements, homeopathy and botanicals, as well as psychotherapy and medication when appropriate. By combining different approaches, Integrative mental health aims to provide a more comprehensive and effective individualized treatment plan. Integrative psychiatry also recognizes the interconnectedness of mental, emotional, and physical health. It acknowledges that mental health disorders can have physical manifestations and that physical health issues can impact mental health. Therefore, integrative psychiatry may incorporate physical therapies such as [yoga](https://gwcim.com/services/yoga/), massage, [acupuncture](https://gwcim.com/services/acupuncture-in-washington-dc/), and other body-centered approaches to promote overall wellness. Importance of Therapeutic Relationships Integrative psychiatry also places emphasis on the importance of the therapeutic relationship between the patient and the healthcare provider. It values a collaborative approach between the patient and their healthcare team and recognizes that the patient's goals and values should be taken into consideration when creating a treatment plan. This approach encourages patients to take an active role in their mental health care, promoting a sense of empowerment and ownership over their healing process. Another important aspect of integrative psychiatry is the focus on cultural sensitivity and diversity. It recognizes that mental health care should be accessible and inclusive for all individuals, regardless of their background or cultural beliefs. Our Providers: Misty Embrey, MD
